intro: Jumelleanthus, commonly known as the "scented beauty," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Jumelleanthus typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
